FuncDef:
The queue mapping command sets the mapping between a queue priority in eight-queue mode and a queue priority in four-queue mode.
The undo queue mapping command restores the default mapping.
By default, mappings between queue priorities in eight-queue mode and queue priorities in four-queue mode are shown in table 1 in Usage Scenario.
CLIs: queue <serviceclass> mapping { cos0 | cos1 | cos2 | cos3 }
undo queue <serviceclass> mapping { cos0 | cos1 | cos2 | cos3 }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a service class.
The value can be BF, AF1, AF2, AF3, AF4, EE, CS6, or CS7.

Set the value of 4cos mapping to cos0.
-

Set the value of 4cos mapping to cos1.
-

Set the value of 4cos mapping to cos2.
-

Set the value of 4cos mapping to cos3.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the mapping between a queue priority in eight-queue mode and a queue priority in four-queue mode in the queue-4cos-mapping profile, run the queue command. After the mapping is configured, you can configure rate limiting for four queues instead of eight queues to reduce workload.
Table 1 The default mappings between 8-CoS priorities and 4-CoS prioritiesQueue Priority in 8-CoS Flow Queue Mode

Queue Priority in 4-CoS Flow Queue Mode



BE,AF1

cos0


AF2,AF3,AF4

cos1


EF

cos2


CS6,CS7

cos3





Prerequisites
A 4-CoS mapping profile has been created and the profile view has been displayed using the queue-4cos-mapping command.
